member.name: T:Nest.CountExtensions
member.summary: Implements a convenience extension method for count that defaults to counting over all indices and types.

member.name: M:Nest.CountExtensions.Count(Nest.IElasticClient,System.Func{Nest.CountDescriptor{System.Object},Nest.CountDescriptor{System.Object}})
member.summary:
The count API allows to easily execute a query and get the number of matches for that query. It can be executed across one or more indices and across one or more types.
This overload returns a dynamic response and defaults to all types and indices
>http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-count.html
member.param: An optional descriptor to describe the count operation

member.name: T:Nest.OpenCloseIndexExtensions
member.summary: Provides convenience extension to open an index by string or type.

member.name: M:Nest.OpenCloseIndexExtensions.OpenIndex(Nest.IElasticClient,System.String)
member.summary:
The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
>http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-open-close.html
member.param: The name of the index to be opened

member.name: M:Nest.OpenCloseIndexExtensions.OpenIndex``1(Nest.IElasticClient)

>http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-open-close.html
member.typeparam: The type used to infer the index name to be opened

member.name: M:Nest.OpenCloseIndexExtensions.CloseIndex(Nest.IElasticClient,System.String)

member.param: The name of the index to be closed

member.name: M:Nest.OpenCloseIndexExtensions.CloseIndex``1(Nest.IElasticClient)

member.name: T:Nest.ExistsExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to provide a cleaner scoll API given a scollTime and scrollId

member.name: T:Nest.ScrollExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to provide a cleaner scoll API given a scollTime and scrollId

member.name: M:Nest.ScrollExtensions.Scroll``1(Nest.IElasticClient,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
A search request can be scrolled by specifying the scroll parameter.
The scroll parameter is a time value parameter (for example: scroll=5m), indicating for how long the nodes that participate in the search will maintain relevant resources in order to continue and support it.
This is very similar in its idea to opening a cursor against a database.
member.typeparam: The type that represents the result hits
member.param: The time the server should wait for the scroll before closing the scan operation
The scroll id to continue the scroll operation

member.name: M:Nest.ScrollExtensions.ScrollAsync``1(Nest.IElasticClient,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
A search request can be scrolled by specifying the scroll parameter.
The scroll parameter is a time value parameter (for example: scroll=5m), indicating for how long the nodes that participate in the search will maintain relevant resources in order to continue and support it.
This is very similar in its idea to opening a cursor against a database.
member.typeparam: The type that represents the result hits
member.param: The time the server should wait for the scroll before closing the scan operation
The scroll id to continue the scroll operation

member.name: T:Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilter

Token filter that generates bigrams for frequently occuring terms. Single terms are still indexed.
Note, common_words or common_words_path field is required.

member.summary: A list of common words to use.

member.name: P:Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilter.CommonWordsPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a list of common words.

member.name: P:Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilter.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If true, common words matching will be case insensitive.

member.name: P:Nest.CommonGramsTokenFilter.QueryMode
member.summary: Generates bigrams then removes common words and single terms followed by a common word.

member.name: T:Nest.KeywordRepeatTokenFilter
member.summary: The keyword_repeat token filter Emits each incoming token twice once as keyword and once as a non-keyword to allow an unstemmed version of a term to be indexed side by side with the stemmed version of the term.

member.name: T:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter
member.summary:
Basic support for hunspell stemming.
Hunspell dictionaries will be picked up from a dedicated hunspell directory on the filesystem.

member.name: P:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter.IgnoreCase
member.summary: If true, dictionary matching will be case insensitive.

member.name: P:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter.Locale
member.summary: A locale for this filter. If this is unset, the lang or language are used instead - so one of these has to be set.

member.name: P:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter.Dictionary
member.summary: The name of a dictionary.

member.name: P:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter.Dedup
member.summary: If only unique terms should be returned, this needs to be set to true.

member.name: P:Nest.HunspellTokenFilter.LongestOnly
member.summary: If only the longest term should be returned, set this to true.

member.name: T:Nest.LimitTokenCountTokenFilter
member.summary: Limits the number of tokens that are indexed per document and field.

member.name: P:Nest.LimitTokenCountTokenFilter.MaxTokenCount
member.summary: The maximum number of tokens that should be indexed per document and field.

member.name: P:Nest.LimitTokenCountTokenFilter.ConsumeAllTokens
member.summary: If set to true the filter exhaust the stream even if max_token_count tokens have been consumed already.

member.name: T:Nest.PatternCaptureTokenFilter
member.summary: The pattern_capture token filter, unlike the pattern tokenizer, emits a token for every capture group in the regular expression.

member.name: P:Nest.PatternCaptureTokenFilter.PreserveOriginal
member.summary: If preserve_original is set to true then it would also emit the original token

member.name: T:Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type keep that only keeps tokens with text contained in a predefined set of words.

member.name: P:Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilter.KeepWords
member.summary: A list of words to keep.

member.name: P:Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilter.KeepWordsPath
member.summary: A path to a words file.

member.name: P:Nest.KeepWordsTokenFilter.KeepWordsCase
member.summary: A boolean indicating whether to lower case the words.

member.name: T:Nest.StemmerOverrideTokenFilter
member.summary: Overrides stemming algorithms, by applying a custom mapping, then protecting these terms from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: P:Nest.StemmerOverrideTokenFilter.Rules
member.summary: A list of mapping rules to use.

member.name: P:Nest.StemmerOverrideTokenFilter.RulesPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a list of mappings.

member.name: T:Nest.UppercaseTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type uppercase that normalizes token text to upper case.

member.name: T:Nest.IPropertyMapping
member.summary: This class allows you to map aspects of a Type's property that influences how NEST treats it.

member.name: P:Nest.IPropertyMapping.Name
member.summary: Override the json property name of a type

member.name: P:Nest.IPropertyMapping.OptOut
member.summary: Ignore this property completely - When mapping automatically using MapFromAttributes() - When Indexing this type do not serialize whatever this value hold

member.name: M:Nest.SearchTemplatePathInfo.CloseOverAutomagicCovariantResultSelector(Nest.ElasticInferrer,Nest.ISearchTemplateRequest)
member.summary: Based on the type information present in this descriptor create method that takes the returned _source and hit and returns the ClrType it should deserialize too. This is so that Documents[A] can contain actual instances of subclasses B, C as well. If you specify types using .Types(typeof(B), typeof(C)) then NEST can automagically create a TypeSelector based on the hits _type property.

member.summary: Allows you to update internal the json.net serializer settings to your liking

member.summary: Add a custom JsonConverter to the build in json serialization by passing in a predicate for a type. This is faster then adding them using AddJsonConverters() because this way they will be part of the cached Json.net contract for a type.

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings`1.SetDefaultIndex(System.String)
member.summary: Index to default to when no index is specified.
member.param: When null/empty/not set might throw NRE later on when not specifying index explicitly while indexing.

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings`1.SetDefaultPropertyNameInferrer(System.Func{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
By default NEST camelCases property names (EmailAddress => emailAddress) that do not have an explicit propertyname either via an ElasticProperty attribute or because they are part of Dictionary where the keys should be treated verbatim.
Here you can register a function that transforms propertynames (default casing, pre- or suffixing)

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings`1.SetDefaultTypeNameInferrer(System.Func{System.Type,System.String})
member.summary: Allows you to override how type names should be represented, the default will call .ToLowerInvariant() on the type's name.

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings`1.MapDefaultTypeIndices(System.Action{Nest.FluentDictionary{System.Type,System.String}})
member.summary: Map types to a index names. Takes precedence over SetDefaultIndex().

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings`1.MapDefaultTypeNames(System.Action{Nest.FluentDictionary{System.Type,System.String}})
member.summary: Allows you to override typenames, takes priority over the global SetDefaultTypeNameInferrer()

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiate a new connectionsettings object that proves ElasticClient with configuration values
member.param:
A single uri representing the root of the node you want to connect to
defaults to http://localhost:9200

The default index/alias name used for operations that expect an index/alias name, By specifying it once alot of magic string can be avoided.
You can also specify specific default index/alias names for types using .SetDefaultTypeIndices(
If you do not specify this, NEST might throw a runtime exception if an explicit indexname was not provided for a call

member.name: M:Nest.ConnectionSettings.#ctor(Elasticsearch.Net.ConnectionPool.IConnectionPool,System.String)
member.summary: Instantiate a new connectionsettings object that proves ElasticClient with configuration values
member.param: A connection pool implementation that'll tell the client what nodes are available

The default index/alias name used for operations that expect an index/alias name, By specifying it once alot of magic string can be avoided.
You can also specify specific default index/alias names for types using .SetDefaultTypeIndices(
If you do not specify this, NEST might throw a runtime exception if an explicit indexname was not provided for a call

member.name: T:Nest.ElasticClient
member.summary: ElasticClient is NEST's strongly typed client which exposes fully mapped elasticsearch endpoints

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Reindex``1(System.Func{Nest.ReindexDescriptor{``0},Nest.ReindexDescriptor{``0}})
member.summary: Helper method that allows you to reindex from one index into another using SCAN and SCROLL.
member.returns: An IObservable you can subscribe to to listen to the progress of the reindexation process

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Scroll``1(Nest.IScrollRequest)
member.summary:
A search request can be scrolled by specifying the scroll parameter.
The scroll parameter is a time value parameter (for example: scroll=5m), indicating for how long the nodes that participate in the search will maintain relevant resources in order to continue and support it.
This is very similar in its idea to opening a cursor against a database.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-request-scroll.html
member.typeparam: The type that represents the result hits
member.param: A descriptor that describes the scroll operation
member.returns: A query response holding T hits as well as the ScrollId for the next scroll operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Update``1(System.Func{Nest.UpdateDescriptor{``0,``0},Nest.UpdateDescriptor{``0,``0}})
member.summary:
The update API allows to update a document based on a script provided.
The operation gets the document (collocated with the shard) from the index, runs the script (with optional script language and parameters), and index back the result (also allows to delete, or ignore the operation).
It uses versioning to make sure no updates have happened during the "get" and "reindex".
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/docs-update.html
member.typeparam: The type to describe the document to be updated
member.param: a descriptor that describes the update operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.UpdateSettings(System.Func{Nest.UpdateSettingsDescriptor,Nest.UpdateSettingsDescriptor})
member.summary:
Change specific index level settings in real time. Note not all index settings CAN be updated.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-update-settings.html
member.param: A descriptor that strongly types all the updateable settings

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Validate``1(System.Func{Nest.ValidateQueryDescriptor{``0},Nest.ValidateQueryDescriptor{``0}})
member.summary:
The validate API allows a user to validate a potentially expensive query without executing it.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-validate.html
member.typeparam: The type used to describe the query
member.param: A descriptor that describes the query operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.OpenIndex(System.Func{Nest.OpenIndexDescriptor,Nest.OpenIndexDescriptor})
member.summary:
The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-open-close.html
member.param: A descriptor thata describes the open index operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.CloseIndex(System.Func{Nest.CloseIndexDescriptor,Nest.CloseIndexDescriptor})
member.summary:
The open and close index APIs allow to close an index, and later on opening it. A closed index has almost no overhead on the cluster (except for maintaining its metadata), and is blocked for read/write operations. A closed index can be opened which will then go through the normal recovery process.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-open-close.html
member.param: A descriptor thata describes the close index operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Refresh(System.Func{Nest.RefreshDescriptor,Nest.RefreshDescriptor})
member.summary:
The refresh API allows to explicitly refresh one or more index, making all operations performed since the last refresh available for search. The (near) real-time capabilities depend on the index engine used.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-refresh.html
member.param: A descriptor that describes the parameters for the refresh operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Segments(System.Func{Nest.SegmentsDescriptor,Nest.SegmentsDescriptor})
member.summary:
Provide low level segments information that a Lucene index (shard level) is built with. Allows to be used to provide more information on the state of a shard and an index, possibly optimization information, data "wasted" on deletes, and so on.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-segments.html
member.param: A descriptor that describes the parameters for the segments operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.ClusterState(System.Func{Nest.ClusterStateDescriptor,Nest.ClusterStateDescriptor})
member.summary:
The cluster state API allows to get a comprehensive state information of the whole cluster.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/cluster-state.html
member.param: A descriptor that describes the parameters for the cluster state operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.PutWarmer(System.String,System.Func{Nest.PutWarmerDescriptor,Nest.PutWarmerDescriptor})
member.summary:
Allows to put a warmup search request on a specific index (or indices), with the body composing of a regular search request. Types can be provided as part of the URI if the search request is designed to be run only against the specific types.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-warmers.html#warmer-adding
member.param: The name for the warmer that you want to register
A descriptor that further describes what the warmer should look like

member.summary:
Getting a warmer for specific index (or alias, or several indices) based on its name.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-warmers.html#warmer-retrieving
member.param: The name of the warmer to get
An optional selector specifying additional parameters for the get warmer operation

Deletes a warmer

member.summary:
Index templates allow to define templates that will automatically be applied to new indices created.
The templates include both settings and mappings, and a simple pattern template that controls if the template will be applied to the index created.

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Flush(System.Func{Nest.FlushDescriptor,Nest.FlushDescriptor})
member.summary:
The flush API allows to flush one or more indices through an API. The flush process of an index basically frees memory from the index by flushing data to the index storage and clearing the internal transaction log. By default, Elasticsearch uses memory heuristics in order to automatically trigger flush operations as required in order to clear memory.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-flush.html
member.param: A descriptor that describes the parameters for the flush operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.Alias(System.Func{Nest.AliasDescriptor,Nest.AliasDescriptor})
member.summary:
APIs in elasticsearch accept an index name when working against a specific index, and several indices when applicable.
The index aliases API allow to alias an index with a name, with all APIs automatically converting the alias name to the actual index name.
An alias can also be mapped to more than one index, and when specifying it, the alias will automatically expand to the aliases indices.i
An alias can also be associated with a filter that will automatically be applied when searching, and routing values.
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-aliases.html
member.param: A desriptor that describes the parameters for the alias operation

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.GetAlias(System.Func{Nest.GetAliasDescriptor,Nest.GetAliasDescriptor})
member.summary:
The get index alias api allows to filter by alias name and index name. This api redirects to the master and fetches the requested index aliases, if available. This api only serialises the found index aliases.
Difference with GetAlias is that this call will also return indices without aliases set
http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/indices-aliases.html#alias-retrieving
member.param: A descriptor that describes which aliases/indexes we are interested int

member.name: M:Nest.IElasticClient.GetAliases(System.Func{Nest.GetAliasesDescriptor,Nest.GetAliasesDescriptor})

The optimize API allows to optimize one or more indices through an API. The optimize process basically optimizes the index for faster search operations (and relates to the number of segments a Lucene index holds within each shard). The optimize operation allows to reduce the number of segments by merging them.

summary.para: Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will go and be executed only on the primary shards.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will go and be executed on the primary shard, and if not available (failover), will execute on other shards.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
The operation will prefer to be executed on a local allocated shard is possible.
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
Restricts the search to execute only on a node with the provided node id
Controls a preference of which shard replicas to execute the search request on. By default, the operation is randomized between the each shard replicas.
Prefers execution on the node with the provided node id if applicable.

member.name: T:Nest.JsonConverterPiggyBackState
member.summary: Registerering global jsonconverters is very costly, The best thing is to specify them as a contract (see ElasticContractResolver) This however prevents a way to give a jsonconverter state which for some calls is needed i.e: A multiget and multisearch need access to the descriptor that describes what types are used. When NEST knows it has to piggyback this it has to pass serialization state it will create a new serializersettings object with a new contract resolver which holds this state. Its ugly but it does boost massive performance gains.

member.name: T:Nest.Language
member.summary: Language types used for language analyzers

member.name: T:Nest.LanguageAnalyzer
member.summary: A set of analyzers aimed at analyzing specific language text.

member.name: P:Nest.LanguageAnalyzer.StopWords
member.summary: A list of stopword to initialize the stop filter with. Defaults to the english stop words.

member.name: P:Nest.LanguageAnalyzer.StopwordsPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a stopwords file configuration.

member.name: T:Nest.KeywordAnalyzer
member.summary:
An analyzer of type keyword that “tokenizes” an entire stream as a single token. This is useful for data like zip codes, ids and so on.
Note, when using mapping definitions, it make more sense to simply mark the field as not_analyzed.

member.name: T:Nest.PatternAnalyzer
member.summary: An analyzer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: T:Nest.StopAnalyzer
member.summary: An analyzer of type stop that is built using a Lower Case Tokenizer, with Stop Token Filter.

member.name: P:Nest.StopAnalyzer.StopWords
member.summary: A list of stopword to initialize the stop filter with. Defaults to the english stop words.

member.name: P:Nest.StopAnalyzer.StopwordsPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a stopwords file configuration.

member.name: T:Nest.WhitespaceAnalyzer
member.summary: An analyzer of type whitespace that is built using a Whitespace Tokenizer.

member.name: T:Nest.SimpleAnalyzer
member.summary: An analyzer of type simple that is built using a Lower Case Tokenizer.

member.name: T:Nest.HtmlStripCharFilter
member.summary: A char filter of type html_strip stripping out HTML elements from an analyzed text.

member.name: T:Nest.MappingCharFilter
member.summary: A char filter of type mapping replacing characters of an analyzed text with given mapping.

member.name: T:Nest.AsciiFoldingTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type asciifolding that converts alphabetic, numeric, and symbolic Unicode characters which are
not in the first 127 ASCII characters (the “Basic Latin” Unicode block) into their ASCII equivalents, if one exists.

member.name: T:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter
member.summary: Token filters that allow to decompose compound words.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.WordList
member.summary: A list of words to use.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.WordListPath
member.summary: A path (either relative to config location, or absolute) to a list of words.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.MinWordSize
member.summary: Minimum word size.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.MinSubwordSize
member.summary: Minimum subword size.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.MaxSubwordSize
member.summary: Maximum subword size.

member.name: P:Nest.CompoundWordTokenFilter.OnlyLongestMatch
member.summary: Only matching the longest.

member.name: T:Nest.TrimTokenFilter
member.summary: The trim token filter trims surrounding whitespaces around a token.

member.name: T:Nest.UniqueTokenFilter
member.summary: The unique token filter can be used to only index unique tokens during analysis. By default it is applied on all the token stream

member.name: P:Nest.UniqueTokenFilter.OnlyOnSamePosition
member.summary: If only_on_same_position is set to true, it will only remove duplicate tokens on the same position.

member.name: T:Nest.TruncateTokenFilter
member.summary:
The truncate token filter can be used to truncate tokens into a specific length. This can come in handy with keyword (single token)
based mapped fields that are used for sorting in order to reduce memory usage.

member.name: P:Nest.TruncateTokenFilter.Length
member.summary: length parameter which control the number of characters to truncate to, defaults to 10.

member.name: T:Nest.ElisionTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter which removes elisions. For example, “l’avion” (the plane) will tokenized as “avion” (plane).

member.name: P:Nest.ElisionTokenFilter.Articles
member.summary: Accepts articles setting which is a set of stop words articles

member.name: T:Nest.ReverseTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type reverse that simply reverses the tokens.

member.name: T:Nest.PhoneticTokenFilter
member.summary: The phonetic token filter is provided as a plugin.

member.name: T:Nest.SnowballTokenFilter
member.summary: A filter that stems words using a Snowball-generated stemmer.

member.name: T:Nest.KStemTokenFilter
member.summary:
The kstem token filter is a high performance filter for english.
All terms must already be lowercased (use lowercase filter) for this filter to work correctly.

member.name: T:Nest.KeywordMarkerTokenFilter
member.summary: Protects words from being modified by stemmers. Must be placed before any stemming filters.

member.name: T:Nest.StemmerTokenFilter
member.summary: A filter that stems words (similar to snowball, but with more options).

member.name: T:Nest.PorterStemTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type porterStem that transforms the token stream as per the Porter stemming algorithm.

member.name: T:Nest.LowercaseTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type lowercase that normalizes token text to lower case.
Lowercase token filter supports Greek and Turkish lowercase token filters through the language parameter.

member.name: T:Nest.LengthTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type length that removes words that are too long or too short for the stream.

member.name: T:Nest.StandardTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type standard that normalizes tokens extracted with the Standard Tokenizer.

member.name: T:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer
member.summary:
The path_hierarchy tokenizer takes something like this:
/something/something/else
And produces tokens:
/something
/something/something
/something/something/else

member.name: P:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer.Delimiter
member.summary: The character delimiter to use, defaults to /.

member.name: P:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer.Replacement
member.summary: An optional replacement character to use. Defaults to the delimiter

member.name: P:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer.BufferSize
member.summary: The buffer size to use, defaults to 1024.

member.name: P:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer.Reverse
member.summary: Generates tokens in reverse order, defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.PathHierarchyTokenizer.Skip
member.summary: Controls initial tokens to skip, defaults to 0.

member.name: T:Nest.UaxEmailUrlTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type uax_url_email which works exactly like the standard tokenizer, but tokenizes emails and urls as single tokens

member.name: P:Nest.UaxEmailUrlTokenizer.MaximumTokenLength
member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is discarded. Defaults to 255.

member.name: T:Nest.PatternTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type pattern that can flexibly separate text into terms via a regular expression.

member.name: P:Nest.PatternTokenizer.Pattern
member.summary: The regular expression pattern, defaults to \W+.

member.name: P:Nest.PatternTokenizer.Flags
member.summary: The regular expression flags.

member.name: P:Nest.PatternTokenizer.Group
member.summary: Which group to extract into tokens. Defaults to -1 (split).

member.name: T:Nest.WhitespaceTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type whitespace that divides text at whitespace.

member.name: T:Nest.StandardTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type standard providing grammar based tokenizer that is a good tokenizer for most European language documents.
The tokenizer implements the Unicode Text Segmentation algorithm, as specified in Unicode Standard Annex #29.

member.name: P:Nest.StandardTokenizer.MaximumTokenLength
member.summary: The maximum token length. If a token is seen that exceeds this length then it is discarded. Defaults to 255.

member.name: T:Nest.NGramTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type nGram.

member.name: T:Nest.LowercaseTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type lowercase that performs the function of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter together.
It divides text at non-letters and converts them to lower case.
While it is functionally equivalent to the combination of Letter Tokenizer and Lower Case Token Filter,
there is a performance advantage to doing the two tasks at once, hence this (redundant) implementation.

member.name: T:Nest.LetterTokenizer
member.summary:
A tokenizer of type letter that divides text at non-letters. That’s to say, it defines tokens as maximal strings of adjacent letters.
Note, this does a decent job for most European languages, but does a terrible job for some Asian languages, where words are not separated by spaces.

member.name: T:Nest.EdgeNGramTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type edgeNGram.

member.name: T:Nest.KeywordTokenizer
member.summary: A tokenizer of type keyword that emits the entire input as a single input.

member.name: P:Nest.KeywordTokenizer.BufferSize
member.summary: The term buffer size. Defaults to 256.

member.name: T:Nest.EdgeNGramTokenFilter
member.summary: A token filter of type edgeNGram.

member.name: F:Nest.DateRounding.Floor
member.summary: (the default), rounds to the lowest whole unit of this field.

member.name: F:Nest.DateRounding.Ceiling
member.summary: Rounds to the highest whole unit of this field.

member.name: F:Nest.DateRounding.HalfFloor
member.summary: Round to the nearest whole unit of this field. If the given millisecond value is closer to the floor or is exactly halfway, this function behaves like floor. If the millisecond value is closer to the ceiling, this function behaves like ceiling.

member.name: F:Nest.DateRounding.HalfCeiling
member.summary: Round to the nearest whole unit of this field. If the given millisecond value is closer to the floor, this function behaves like floor. If the millisecond value is closer to the ceiling or is exactly halfway, this function behaves like ceiling.

member.name: F:Nest.DateRounding.HalfEven
member.summary: Round to the nearest whole unit of this field. If the given millisecond value is closer to the floor, this function behaves like floor. If the millisecond value is closer to the ceiling, this function behaves like ceiling. If the millisecond value is exactly halfway between the floor and ceiling, the ceiling is chosen over the floor only if it makes this field’s value even.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Match(System.Action{Nest.MatchQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: The default text query is of type boolean. It means that the text provided is analyzed and the analysis process constructs a boolean query from the provided text.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.MatchPhrase(System.Action{Nest.MatchPhraseQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: The text_phrase query analyzes the text and creates a phrase query out of the analyzed text.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.MultiMatch(System.Action{Nest.MultiMatchQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: The multi_match query builds further on top of the match query by allowing multiple fields to be specified. The idea here is to allow to more easily build a concise match type query over multiple fields instead of using a relatively more expressive query by using multiple match queries within a bool query.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Nested(System.Action{Nest.NestedQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: Nested query allows to query nested objects / docs (see nested mapping). The query is executed against the nested objects / docs as if they were indexed as separate docs (they are, internally) and resulting in the root parent doc (or parent nested mapping).

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Conditionless(System.Action{Nest.ConditionlessQueryDescriptor{`0}})

member.summary: The indices query can be used when executed across multiple indices, allowing to have a query that executes only when executed on an index that matches a specific list of indices, and another query that executes when it is executed on an index that does not match the listed indices.

member.summary: custom_boost_factor query allows to wrap another query and multiply its score by the provided boost_factor. This can sometimes be desired since boost value set on specific queries gets normalized, while this query boost factor does not.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Bool(System.Action{Nest.BoolQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: A query that matches documents matching boolean combinations of other queries. The bool query maps to Lucene BooleanQuery. It is built using one or more boolean clauses, each clause with a typed occurrence

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Boosting(System.Action{Nest.BoostingQueryDescriptor{`0}})
member.summary: the boosting query can be used to effectively demote results that match a given query. Unlike the “NOT” clause in bool query, this still selects documents that contain undesirable terms, but reduces their overall score.

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.MatchAll(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.String)
member.summary: A query that matches all documents. Maps to Lucene MatchAllDocsQuery.
member.param: An optional boost to associate with this match_all

When indexing, a boost value can either be associated on the document level, or per field. The match all query does not take boosting into account by default. In order to take boosting into account, the norms_field needs to be provided in order to explicitly specify which field the boosting will be done on (Note, this will result in slower execution time).

member.name: M:Nest.QueryDescriptor`1.Wildcard(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{`0,System.Object}},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{Nest.RewriteMultiTerm})
member.summary: Matches documents that have fields matching a wildcard expression (not analyzed). Supported wildcards are *, which matches any character sequence (including the empty one), and ?, which matches any single character. Note this query can be slow, as it needs to iterate over many terms. In order to prevent extremely slow wildcard queries, a wildcard term should not start with one of the wildcards * or ?. The wildcard query maps to Lucene WildcardQuery.

The wildcard query maps to Lucene WildcardQuery.

member.name: M:Nest.SearchPathInfo.CloseOverAutomagicCovariantResultSelector(Nest.ElasticInferrer,Nest.ISearchRequest)
member.summary: Based on the type information present in this descriptor create method that takes the returned _source and hit and returns the ClrType it should deserialize too. This is so that Documents[A] can contain actual instances of subclasses B, C as well. If you specify types using .Types(typeof(B), typeof(C)) then NEST can automagically create a TypeSelector based on the hits _type property.

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchResponse`1.Documents
member.summary:
Returns a view on the documents inside the hits that are returned.
NOTE: if you use Fields() on the search descriptor .Documents will be empty use .Fields instead or try the 'source filtering' feature introduced in Elasticsearch 1.0 using .Source() on the search descriptor to get Documents of type T with only certain parts selected

member.name: P:Nest.ISearchResponse`1.FieldSelections

member.name: T:Nest.CustomAnalyzer
member.summary:
An analyzer of type custom that allows to combine a Tokenizer with zero or more Token Filters, and zero or more Char Filters.
The custom analyzer accepts a logical/registered name of the tokenizer to use, and a list of logical/registered names of token filters.

member.name: T:Nest.IndexSettings
member.summary: Writing these uses a custom converter that ignores the json props

member.name: P:Nest.IndexSettings.AsExpando
member.summary: Dynamic view of the settings object, useful for reading value from the settings as it allows you to chain without nullrefs. Cannot be used to assign setting values though

member.name: T:Nest.SnowballAnalyzer
member.summary:
An analyzer of type snowball that uses the standard tokenizer, with standard filter, lowercase filter, stop filter, and snowball filter.
The Snowball Analyzer is a stemming analyzer from Lucene that is originally based on the snowball project from snowball.tartarus.org.

member.name: T:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter
member.summary:
A token filter of type shingle that constructs shingles (token n-grams) from a token stream.
In other words, it creates combinations of tokens as a single token.

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.MinShingleSize
member.summary: The minimum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.MaxShingleSize
member.summary: The maximum shingle size. Defaults to 2.

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigrams
member.summary: If true the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) as well as the shingles. Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.OutputUnigramsIfNoShingles
member.summary:
If output_unigrams is false the output will contain the input tokens (unigrams) if no shingles are available.
Note if output_unigrams is set to true this setting has no effect. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:Nest.ShingleTokenFilter.TokenSeparator
member.summary: The string to use when joining adjacent tokens to form a shingle. Defaults to " ".
